test_cases.test_name: Verify Document Classification with Vendor Scripting
test_cases.objective: To ensure the system correctly classifies documents using the vendor's rule-based scripting.

test_steps.action: Upload a set of sample documents to the system.
test_steps.expected_result: Documents are successfully uploaded and queued for classification.

test_steps.action: Apply the vendor's rule-based scripting to classify the documents.
test_steps.expected_result: Documents are classified according to the defined rules.

test_steps.action: Review the classification results in the validation queue.
test_steps.expected_result: Classification results are accurate and available for review.

acceptance_criteria: Documents are classified correctly based on vendor scripting rules
Classification results are available in the validation queue
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure document metadata integrity during classification

test_cases.test_name: Validate Duplicate Detection and Resolution Workflow
test_cases.objective: To verify the system's ability to detect and resolve duplicate documents in the eTMF.
prerequisites: Sample documents with duplicates are available

test_steps.action: Upload a set of sample documents, including duplicates, to the system.
test_steps.expected_result: Documents are successfully uploaded and queued for processing.

test_steps.action: Run the duplicate detection process on the uploaded documents.
test_steps.expected_result: Duplicates are detected and flagged by the system.

test_steps.action: Resolve the flagged duplicates using the provided workflow.
test_steps.expected_result: Duplicates are resolved according to the defined workflow.

acceptance_criteria: Duplicates are detected and flagged correctly
Duplicates are resolved according to the workflow
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure document metadata integrity during duplicate resolution

test_cases.test_name: Verify Document Classification Plugin Integration
test_cases.objective: To ensure that custom-developed classification plugins integrate correctly with the eTMF indexing service and classify documents accurately.

test_steps.action: Upload a test document to the eTMF indexing service.
test_steps.expected_result: Document is successfully uploaded and visible in the validation queue.

test_steps.action: Apply the custom classification plugin to the uploaded document.
test_steps.expected_result: Document is classified according to the plugin's rules.

test_steps.action: Review the classification result in the validation queue.
test_steps.expected_result: Classification result matches expected output based on plugin rules.

acceptance_criteria: Document is classified correctly
Classification result is traceable
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure classification results are accurate and traceable

test_cases.test_name: Validate Duplicate Detection Workflow
test_cases.objective: To verify that the duplicate detection and resolution workflow functions as intended.

test_steps.action: Upload a duplicate document to the eTMF indexing service.
test_steps.expected_result: Duplicate document is detected and flagged.

test_steps.action: Initiate the duplicate resolution workflow.
test_steps.expected_result: Workflow prompts for resolution action.

test_steps.action: Resolve the duplicate document.
test_steps.expected_result: Duplicate document is resolved according to workflow rules.

acceptance_criteria: Duplicate document is detected
Resolution workflow functions correctly
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure duplicate resolution is traceable

test_cases.test_name: Custom Plugin Integration and Classification Validation
test_cases.objective: Verify that custom-developed classification plugins can be integrated and correctly classify edge-case documents according to sponsor-specific taxonomies.

test_steps.action: Upload the custom plugin to the eTMF Index Harmonization service.
test_steps.expected_result: Plugin is successfully uploaded and recognized by the system.

test_steps.action: Process test documents with edge-case classifications using the custom plugin.
test_steps.expected_result: Documents are correctly classified according to sponsor-specific taxonomies.

test_steps.action: Verify traceability from source entry to final TMF artifact.
test_steps.expected_result: Full traceability is maintained for all processed documents.

acceptance_criteria: Custom plugin is successfully integrated and functional.
Edge-case documents are correctly classified.
Traceability is maintained for all processed documents.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all metadata transformations are traceable and auditable.
Maintain ALCOA+ integrity for document metadata.

test_cases.test_name: Performance Testing for Document Processing
test_cases.objective: Validate that the system can process 10,000 documents per hour with standard rule sets and maintain classification latency under 2 seconds.

test_steps.action: Load 10,000 test documents into the system for processing.
test_steps.expected_result: Documents are queued for processing without errors.

test_steps.action: Start processing and monitor the time taken to complete classification.
test_steps.expected_result: All documents are processed within 1 hour.

test_steps.action: Measure classification latency for a sample of single documents.
test_steps.expected_result: Classification latency is less than 2 seconds per document.

acceptance_criteria: 10,000 documents are processed within 1 hour.
Classification latency is under 2 seconds per document.
System performance metrics are within expected ranges.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure no data loss during high-volume processing.
Maintain audit trails for all processed documents.

test_cases.test_name: Validation of Document Classification Plugin Integration
test_cases.objective: To verify that custom-developed classification plugins integrate correctly with the eTMF Index Harmonization service and classify documents as expected.
prerequisites: Access to eTMF Index Harmonization service

test_steps.action: Upload a test document to the eTMF Index Harmonization service.
test_steps.expected_result: The document is successfully uploaded and visible in the validation queue.

test_steps.action: Apply the custom classification plugin to the uploaded document.
test_steps.expected_result: The document is classified according to the plugin's logic and metadata is updated accordingly.

test_steps.action: Review the classification results in the validation queue.
test_steps.expected_result: The classification results match the expected output based on the plugin's logic.

acceptance_criteria: Custom classification plugin integrates correctly with the eTMF Index Harmonization service.
Documents are classified accurately based on the plugin's logic.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all document metadata transformations maintain ALCOA+ integrity.

test_cases.test_name: Performance Testing of Batch Reprocessing
test_cases.objective: To ensure the eTMF Index Harmonization service can handle batch reprocessing of documents efficiently within the specified performance requirements.

test_steps.action: Initiate batch reprocessing of 10,000 documents using a versioned ruleset.
test_steps.expected_result: The batch reprocessing starts without errors and progresses as expected.

test_steps.action: Monitor the processing rate and system performance metrics.
test_steps.expected_result: The system processes documents at a rate of 10,000 documents/hour or faster.

test_steps.action: Verify the completion of batch reprocessing and review the results.
test_steps.expected_result: All documents are reprocessed successfully, and the results match the expected output based on the ruleset.

acceptance_criteria: Batch reprocessing completes within the specified performance requirements.
All documents are reprocessed accurately based on the versioned ruleset.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all document metadata transformations maintain ALCOA+ integrity.

test_cases.test_name: Validation of Document Classification Plugins
test_cases.objective: To verify that custom-developed classification plugins correctly classify edge-case documents according to sponsor-specific taxonomies.

test_steps.action: Upload a set of edge-case documents to the eTMF indexing service.
test_steps.expected_result: Documents are processed by the custom classification plugin.

test_steps.action: Review the classification results in the validation queue.
test_steps.expected_result: Documents are correctly classified according to sponsor-specific taxonomies.

acceptance_criteria: All edge-case documents are correctly classified.
Classification results are traceable and auditable.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure metadata transformations maintain ALCOA+ integrity.

test_cases.test_name: Performance Testing of Batch Reprocessing
test_cases.objective: To ensure the eTMF indexing service can handle batch reprocessing of documents with versioned rulesets efficiently.
prerequisites: Batch of documents available for reprocessing

test_steps.action: Initiate batch reprocessing of 10,000 documents using a versioned ruleset.
test_steps.expected_result: Documents are reprocessed within the specified performance threshold.

test_steps.action: Monitor the system dashboard for completeness KPIs.
test_steps.expected_result: Dashboard updates within the specified load time.

acceptance_criteria: Batch reprocessing completes within 1 hour.
Dashboard load time is less than 5 seconds.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all document metadata transformations maintain ALCOA+ integrity.

test_cases.test_name: Custom Plugin Integration and Classification Validation
test_cases.objective: Verify the system's ability to integrate and execute custom-developed classification plugins for edge-case documents.

test_steps.action: Upload the custom plugin to the eTMF indexing service.
test_steps.expected_result: Plugin is successfully uploaded and recognized by the system.

test_steps.action: Process a set of edge-case documents using the custom plugin.
test_steps.expected_result: Documents are correctly classified according to the custom plugin logic.

acceptance_criteria: Custom plugin is integrated without errors
Edge-case documents are accurately classified
data_integrity_requirements: ALCOA+ integrity for document metadata transformations

test_cases.test_name: Dashboard Performance with Large Data Volume
test_cases.objective: Ensure the configurable dashboards load within the specified time frame when handling large data volumes.

test_steps.action: Access the configured dashboard with 1M records.
test_steps.expected_result: Dashboard loads within 5 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: Dashboard load time is less than 5 seconds

test_cases.test_name: Custom Plugin Integration and Classification Validation
test_cases.objective: Verify that custom-developed classification plugins correctly integrate with the system and accurately classify edge-case documents.
prerequisites: Test documents with edge-case classification requirements

test_steps.action: Deploy a custom classification plugin to the eTMF Index Harmonization service.
test_steps.expected_result: Plugin is successfully loaded and recognized by the system.

test_steps.action: Upload a set of test documents that require custom classification logic.
test_steps.expected_result: Documents are correctly classified according to the custom plugin's logic.

test_steps.action: Review the traceability logs for the classified documents.
test_steps.expected_result: Traceability logs show the correct path from source entry to final TMF artifact, including plugin involvement.

acceptance_criteria: Custom plugin successfully integrates with the system.
Edge-case documents are classified accurately.
Traceability logs are complete and accurate.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all document metadata transformations maintain ALCOA+ integrity.
Audit trails must be retained for all classification actions.

test_cases.test_name: Performance Testing for High-Volume Document Processing
test_cases.objective: Validate that the system can process 10,000 documents per hour with standard rule sets while maintaining acceptable latency.
prerequisites: Test environment with performance monitoring tools
10,000 test documents with standard classification requirements

test_steps.action: Configure the system with standard rule sets for document classification.
test_steps.expected_result: System is ready to process documents with the configured rule sets.

test_steps.action: Upload 10,000 test documents to the system for processing.
test_steps.expected_result: System processes all documents within one hour.

test_steps.action: Monitor classification latency for individual documents.
test_steps.expected_result: Classification latency for single documents is less than 2 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: System processes 10,000 documents per hour.
Classification latency for single documents is less than 2 seconds.
System remains stable under high load.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all document metadata is accurately maintained during high-volume processing.
Audit trails must be complete and uncorrupted.

test_cases.test_name: Custom Plugin Integration and Classification Validation
test_cases.objective: Verify that custom-developed classification plugins correctly classify edge-case documents according to sponsor-specific taxonomies.
prerequisites: Test documents with edge-case classification requirements

test_steps.action: Load a custom-developed classification plugin into the eTMF Index Harmonization service.
test_steps.expected_result: Plugin is successfully loaded and recognized by the system.

test_steps.action: Upload a test document that requires edge-case classification.
test_steps.expected_result: Document is classified according to the custom plugin's rules.

test_steps.action: Verify the classification metadata in the TMF artifact.
test_steps.expected_result: Metadata matches the expected sponsor-specific taxonomy.

acceptance_criteria: Custom plugins must correctly classify edge-case documents.
System must maintain traceability from source to final artifact.
data_integrity_requirements: Metadata transformations must maintain ALCOA+ integrity.
Audit trails must capture all classification changes.

test_cases.test_name: High-Volume Document Processing Performance
test_cases.objective: Validate that the system can process 10,000 documents/hour with standard rule sets while maintaining acceptable latency.

test_steps.action: Configure the system with standard rule sets for TMF Reference Model v3.3.
test_steps.expected_result: Rule sets are active and validated.

test_steps.action: Initiate batch processing of 10,000 test documents.
test_steps.expected_result: System begins processing documents without errors.

test_steps.action: Monitor processing rate and system resources for 60 minutes.
test_steps.expected_result: System maintains ≥ 10,000 documents/hour throughput.

acceptance_criteria: Throughput must meet or exceed 10,000 documents/hour.
Classification latency must remain < 2 seconds for single documents.
System must remain stable under load.
data_integrity_requirements: All documents must be processed without data loss.
Processing metrics must be accurately recorded.

test_cases.test_name: Custom Plugin Integration and Classification Test
test_cases.objective: Verify that custom-developed classification plugins can be integrated and correctly classify edge-case documents according to sponsor-specific taxonomies.
prerequisites: Test documents with edge-case taxonomies available

test_steps.action: Deploy a custom classification plugin using the provided SDK.
test_steps.expected_result: Plugin is successfully loaded and recognized by the eTMF indexing service.

test_steps.action: Upload a set of test documents with edge-case taxonomies.
test_steps.expected_result: Documents are processed and classified according to the custom plugin rules.

test_steps.action: Verify the traceability of the classification results back to the source documents.
test_steps.expected_result: Full traceability is maintained from source entry to final TMF artifact.

acceptance_criteria: Custom plugin successfully classifies edge-case documents.
Traceability is maintained for all processed documents.
No system errors during plugin deployment or document processing.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all document metadata transformations maintain ALCOA+ integrity.

test_cases.test_name: Performance Test for High-Volume Document Processing
test_cases.objective: Validate that the system can process 10,000 documents per hour with standard rule sets while maintaining acceptable latency.
prerequisites: Test environment with performance monitoring tools

test_steps.action: Load 10,000 test documents into the system for processing.
test_steps.expected_result: Documents are queued for processing without errors.

test_steps.action: Monitor the system for one hour while documents are processed.
test_steps.expected_result: System processes all documents within one hour.

test_steps.action: Verify that classification latency remains under 2 seconds for single documents during peak load.
test_steps.expected_result: Latency meets the specified requirement.

acceptance_criteria: System processes 10,000 documents per hour.
Classification latency remains under 2 seconds for single documents.
System availability is maintained at ≥ 99.9% during the test.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure no data loss or corruption during high-volume processing.

test_cases.test_name: Verify Custom Classification Plugin Integration
test_cases.objective: Ensure the system correctly integrates and executes custom-developed classification plugins for edge-case documents.

test_steps.action: Upload a set of edge-case documents to the system.
test_steps.expected_result: Documents are successfully uploaded and queued for classification.

test_steps.action: Execute the custom classification plugin on the uploaded documents.
test_steps.expected_result: Documents are classified according to the custom plugin logic.

test_steps.action: Review the classification results in the validation queue.
test_steps.expected_result: Classification results are accurate and available for human review.

acceptance_criteria: Custom plugin executes without errors
Classification results are accurate
Validation queue reflects correct results
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure data integrity during plugin execution
Maintain audit trails for classification actions

test_cases.test_name: Validate Batch Reprocessing with Versioned Rulesets
test_cases.objective: Verify the system correctly reprocesses documents using versioned rulesets and maintains traceability.

test_steps.action: Select a batch of previously processed documents for reprocessing.
test_steps.expected_result: Documents are successfully queued for reprocessing.

test_steps.action: Apply a versioned ruleset to the selected documents and initiate reprocessing.
test_steps.expected_result: Documents are reprocessed according to the new ruleset.

test_steps.action: Review the reprocessed documents in the validation queue.
test_steps.expected_result: Reprocessed documents reflect the updated ruleset and are available for review.

acceptance_criteria: Reprocessing completes without errors
Documents reflect updated ruleset
Traceability is maintained
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure data integrity during reprocessing
Maintain audit trails for reprocessing actions
